Data.Description: Left: The evolution of the maximum temperature (K) RMSE over a single time step for the Test simulation (orange) and the Baseline simulation (blue), plotted with a log scale on the y-axis. The x-axis details the physical parameterizations and/or Fortran code modules executed within this time step. Right: the blue line indicates the Baseline ensemble mean at the end of the time step and the orange circle is the Test ensemble mean. The orange box highlights the threshold values corresponding to the critical P 5.0% in the two-sided t-test. For the test to pass, the orange box must overlap the blue line. Note: The orange box may appear exceptionally large as  these  values  are very close to zero and the mean ± Tc*σ/√N range may cross zero, where Tc is the  critical t-test value, σ is the ensemble standard deviation, N is the size of the ensemble, and σ/√N represents the t-test scaling parameter.
Data.Title: PGN_P1x1.ne4_ne4.FC5AV1C-L.cori-knl_intel.C.20190801_154712_6vlllj

Yun Qian, Hui Wan, Ben Yang, Jean-Christophe Golaz, Bryce Harrop, Zhangshuan Hou, Vincent E. Larson, L. Ruby Leung, Guangxing Lin, Wuyin Lin, Po-Lun Ma, Hsi-Yen Ma, Phil Rasch, Balwinder Singh, Hailong Wang, Shaocheng Xie, and Kai Zhang. Parametric sensitivity and uncertainty quantification in the version 1 of e3sm atmosphere model based on short perturbed parameter ensemble simulations. Journal of Geophysical Research: Atmospheres, 123(23):13,046–13,073, 2018. URL: https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1029/2018JD028927, arXiv:https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/pdf/10.1029/2018JD028927, doi:10.1029/2018JD028927.

Description:
The Perturbation Growth Test:
This tests the null hypothesis that the reference (n) and modified (m) model
ensembles represent the same atmospheric state after each physics parameterization
is applied within a single time-step using the two-sample (n and m) T-test for equal
averages at a 95% confidence level. Ensembles are generated by repeating the
simulation for many initial conditions, with each initial condition subject to
multiple perturbations.
Title: pge_zmconv_c0_ocn_0.045
